intro: Trichinium aervoides, commonly known as the common nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, hair-covered stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and it is known for its stinging hairs that can cause skin irritation. Trichinium aervoides is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. It plays a role in supporting pollinators and serves as a host plant for certain insects.
